title: How to Have a Party for 100 Dollars

steps.headline: Make a list.
steps.description: The most important step when trying to keep within a budget is to make a list and stick to it. Try to set an approximate price for all the supplies you need and calculate before you shop. You might even want to go to some stores or online to check prices. Start off with the main things. Food, tables, decorations for the walls and ceiling (optional), invitations and cake(optional).

steps.headline: Use bright colors and a key centerpiece: Sometimes less is more.
steps.description: With bright colors and a statement piece (for example; hanging empty, colorful frames from the ceiling, so they hang in mid air), it will take on a very bold look. Set the tables up with bright blue, pink and, green tablecloths. This will not take a lot of your budget, leaving more cash for your other purchases.

steps.headline: Shop at the dollar store: The dollar store will have most what you need for the décor and some of food.
steps.description: Yes the quality may be lower, but you only need it for a day. It's also easy on the budget.

steps.headline: Add lights.
steps.description: Use your Christmas lights and string them from your ceiling in a swooping motion. Consider hanging lanterns at various heights to add lighting. You do not have to use lights. You could string fake flowers by fishing line to give your room a magical feeling.

steps.headline: Choose your location: While many people have house parties, keep in mind outdoor places that are scenic.
steps.description: It saves a lot in the end. Does your neighbor have an awesome garden for a tea party? Are there picnic tables at the lake, where you can celebrate a sweet 16. If you want to plan the party in your home choose an area that is open and easy to decorate.

steps.headline: Choose a buffet over sit-down meals: You might want to consider some economical pizza places.
steps.description: Try having bulk of one dish like chili or pasta, then have complimentary bowls alongside (buns, bread sticks, crackers, vegetable or fruit platter. You can also have snacks like the classic chips and dip or cheeses. Swipe things from your kitchen. Cut and roll up ham with a small piece of cheese with a toothpick or peanut butter and jam minis (use round crackers or small slices of bread). Get creative with what you have.

steps.headline: Be realistic about the size of your party.
steps.description: Think about the occasion that you are celebrating. You know that you are on a budget. Depending upon the occasion, invite a few close friends or neighbors, rather than the whole neighborhood, This way you can enjoy yourself, and not be concerned about not having enough food for everyone.

steps.headline: Enjoy it!
steps.description: : You know a party is really a group of people that you are close to celebrating an event. If planning and such stresses you out, don't let it. Throw on some music. Use the $100 to buy some party food and beverages and dance the night away. As long as you and your guests are having fun your party is perfect.
